snippet.textDisplay: Just about can't bear to watch these times with Kobe knowing what a beautiful human being the world has lost.   I felt the most impact from this loss due our ages being the same and our love of family being the same.   When my Father, who has never been a sports fan in his life, reaches out to me the day after this tragedy to extend his concern and condolences to me, just a fan and a regular ole person, it speaks volumes as to the reach of Kobe Bryant.  RIP to all the beautiful people who lost their lives.

snippet.textDisplay:
I remember giving the eulogy at my sister's funeral, crying so, I could barely utter the words. Not til my youngest brother (I have 7) stood beside me, putting his arm around me! I get it, I feel for his 3 girls, wife, his mom and dad. Life will eventually go on! Each passing day, you will find moments of peace and happiness. But, losing a loved one is not something we ever "get over", you just get up and get on!

RIP - 9..
snippet.textOriginal:
I remember giving the eulogy at my sister's funeral, crying so, I could barely utter the words. Not til my youngest brother (I have 7) stood beside me, putting his arm around me! But, losing a loved one is not something we ever "get over", you just get up and get on! 

RIP - 9..

snippet.textDisplay: I'm not even really an NBA fan and I'm in tears. I know he meant a lot to everyone, and was someone so many people even looked up to, and was just a great person. Not to mention how even more devastating it was that his daughter's life was also taken, among multiple other people. It's a tragedy. Imagine finding out that one of your daughters and your husband were both killed. I don't even know how you would deal with that.
snippet.textOriginal: I'm not even really an NBA fan and I'm in tears. I know he meant a lot to everyone, and was someone so many people even looked up to, and was just a great person. Not to mention how even more devastating it was that his daughter's life was also taken, among multiple other people. It's a tragedy. Imagine finding out that one of your daughters and your husband were both killed. I don't even know how you would deal with that.

snippet.textDisplay:
I am still shocked by the fact that Kobe has left the world forever even after a week the accident occurred.

Kobe is absolutely inspiring for so many generations with no doubt!
That spirit of pursuing perfection truly is what Kobe’s fans love about him.
I wish that we can still pass on this “Mamba Mentality” to our future generations so they will understand how Kobe has spent his life time to influence and inspire people to pursue excellence in whatever fields they are in and never give up no matter what challenges are up front!

Kobe, you are a true legend and will never be forgotten❤️
Rest In Peace, Kobe and GiGi😢
snippet.textOriginal:

That spirit of pursuing perfection truly is what Kobe’s fans love about him.
I wish that we can still pass on this “Mamba Mentality” to our future generations so they will understand how Kobe has spent his life time to influence and inspire people to pursue excellence in whatever fields they are in and never give up no matter what challenges are up front!

Kobe, you are a true legend and will never be forgotten❤️
Rest In Peace, Kobe and GiGi😢

snippet.textDisplay: Praying doesn't do anything.  Stop asking people to pray.  You might as well ask them to do a rain dance.  I applaud the tribute to a fallen hero and an icon of the culture and society of his time, but please... enough with the childish, superstitious nonsense about praying.  You can express condolences and appreciation and sorrow without resorting to medieval references about supernatural fantasies.
snippet.textOriginal: Praying doesn't do anything.  Stop asking people to pray.  You might as well ask them to do a rain dance. snippet.textDisplay:
“Texas for Truth,” an organization based in Georgetown, Texas, invited Falun Gong practitioners to present information about the persecution of Falun Gong at its weekly meeting on June 10.


Falun Gong practitioners were invited to a meeting of “Texas for Truth” on June 10, 2017.

Two short documentaries—one an introduction to Falun Gong and the other about the state-sanctioned forced organ harvesting from jailed Falun Gong practitioners in China—were screened.

Appalled to learn of this “unprecedented crime” of state-sanctioned forced organ harvesting, every person in the audience wanted to know more.

Among the questions they asked were: “Why is the Chinese Communist Party persecuting Falun Gong.” “Do any Americans go to China for organ transplants?” and “What has the American government done to stop the crime of forced organ harvesting in China?”
snippet.textOriginal:
“Texas for Truth,” an organization based in Georgetown, Texas, invited Falun Gong practitioners to present information about the persecution of Falun Gong at its weekly meeting on June 10.


Falun Gong practitioners were invited to a meeting of “Texas for Truth” on June 10, 2017.

Two short documentaries—one an introduction to Falun Gong and the other about the state-sanctioned forced organ harvesting from jailed Falun Gong practitioners in China—were screened.

Appalled to learn of this “unprecedented crime” of state-sanctioned forced organ harvesting, every person in the audience wanted to know more.

Among the questions they asked were: “Why is the Chinese Communist Party persecuting Falun Gong.” “Do any Americans go to China for organ transplants?” and “What has the American government done to stop the crime of forced organ harvesting in China?”

snippet.textDisplay:
Is there any other better ways the governments and  Aviation Industry world wide would be able to join forces and recommend the  installation of safety tools, parts and equipment to all airplanes? This is because many lives can be saved when panicking moments of airplane crush begin. The one to five minutes of detection of engine failure or some parts of airplane failure that will lead to the crash, will be used for evacuation without injury or death.

One: There should be easily deployable and ready backpack parachutes next to each passenger seat.

Two: There should be prior education on how to use those parachutes and how to fast exit the airplane during emergency leading to a crash. This is important because their lives depend on this education. It is my recommendation that it be taken seriously. 

Three:  There should be an easy hind exit that can automatically drop down or easily accessed with an independent power source switch just incase the main airplane source of power supply malfunctions. In this way those who are able to make it out, can survive the crush.

Four: Newly flying passengers should attend the classes about airplane`s emergency Exit-flights for survival.

If the news is true, about Kobe`s helicopter hovered for a while before it crushed, then it tells me that Kobe and the entire crew,  would have exited the plane through the hind special door with some easily deployable parachutes (if they were available to them and if they were informed about the evacuation process). This because their airplane was hovering low (according to the witnesses from the ground). If there were easily deployable parachutes, they could have used them to land safely on terrains or trees with a few scratches which is better than dying.

I wish this message could reach those powerful people in politics and Aviation  industry to try and make some few substantial changes in each airplane more especially  Installing Special Hind Exits and Easily Deployable backpack parachutes next to each passenger and a special Technological Equipment that will alert the pilot about a specific malfunction of the airplane that will shortly lead to a crash and time left before the crush. In this way the pilot will announce the evacuation plan since everybody onboard has already been educated on how evacuate the plane. 

This is a primitive suggestion from my part but I believe that some lives can be saved if every airplane could have a special hind door like that found in the US Army Helicopters and other big Amy Airplanes.

Five: There  should be free or government subsidized sky diving Organizations that offer sky diving lessons at cheap costs to the interested citizens who take flights regularly or intend to take flights in future in that way they can overcome the fear of diving from an airplane when alerted in the airplane in less than 3 minutes before the crash. I don't expect everybody to survive but those who will try their luck using the evacuation education they had already received would survive.

The world has lost very important people Just because they never had accessible Chances to try to evacuate the crashing Airplane in less than three minutes. Three to one minute minutes are a very long time to escape death just by trying

Two passage air planes should have special upward Jolting seats like those in the Army Jets. In this way passengers can be able to survive the crush.
Sorry my language is not brushed well it is my best tool for now I can use.

This issue is vey touching to me because three days before I heard Kobe`s Helicopter Crushed, I heard told my wife that I had dreamt about a hovering  helicopter  in the sky where I was standing but a little further a way in front of me. its color was between blue and green. I saw its tail come off it and it was balancing in the sky for a minute or two. Then the whole of it started whirling as fast as its main rotator. then I saw it whirl down and it crushed.

I and other people ran to the scene that was a bout half a mile a way. I then saw people grabbing wallets from dead and injured adults and taking money from them and I started shouting at them to take that money back to their owners even if they were dead. I saw bloody 12 children lined up on the ground conscious and unconscious who looked to be the ages between 6 to 14.

I saw this one boy who looked to a bout 8 years old spreading his arms towards me asking for help. I went to the kid and heartbroken on their condition they were in, and told him that help was on the way. I then asked him of what happened, he told me that before they took off, the airplane was in hurry and they did not have time to make a second trip and that is why they were overloaded in the airplane. The boy said to me that they were many of them in the airplane and he thought maybe that is why it fell from the sky. Please I am saying Exactly what the dream was a bout. I am not adding or extracting anything from it. Then I told the injured boy that thanks to God they are a life. That is the most important. Then I heard one of common people who happened to be among the rescuers say to the injured people that they were waiting for ambulance because he had already called 911.

I am sorry this is along message, but it feels good to me that I have put it out there for sharing in order to find the common ground for increasing better chances of saving savable lives in in times of air emergency.

snippet.textDisplay: Jimmy is a straight up guy. Love you Jimmy and thank you for this tribute to Kobe. As a huge fan of Kobe these clips of this very unique and special man are heartbreaking, but at the same time healing. My prayers are with and for all the families. I pray they can find peace and somehow heal from losing their loved ones in such an unexpected tragic way.

snippet.textDisplay: 0:46 - 1:01 That "almost everything is more important than basketball" comment was totally unecessary ugh. That's exactly what Kobe represented - not WHAT you do, but HOW YOU DO IT. To call him flatly a "hero" is not a slight in the least bit to first responders.
